responses.rationale: The segment describes the cause of disease spread factually, without reporting prices/metrics or using vivid/potent verbs or risk adjectives.
The segment reports a numerical metric ('23 states') using a standard descriptive verb ('shows') without vivid verbs or risk adjectives.
The segment describes locations of cases factually, without reporting prices/metrics or using vivid/potent verbs or risk adjectives.
The segment reports a numerical metric ('11.7 million turkeys annually') using a standard descriptive verb ('raises') without vivid verbs or risk adjectives.
The segment reports numerical metrics ('46 million chickens') using standard descriptive verbs ('had') without vivid verbs or risk adjectives.
The segment reports numerical metrics ('13 million chickens and 305,000 turkeys') using a factual verb ('kill') describing a consequence, not a vivid verb describing metric change.
The segment reports numerical metrics ('22 million birds', '1.8 million broiler chickens', etc.) using a factual verb ('kill') describing a consequence, not a vivid verb describing metric change.
The segment reports a numerical metric ('at least 26 states') using standard descriptive verbs ('found', 'circulating') without vivid verbs or risk adjectives.
The segment reports numerical metrics ('22 million', '13 million', '18 million') using standard descriptive verbs ('correct') without vivid verbs or risk adjectives.
The segment reports numerical metrics ('22 million', '13 million', '18 million') using standard descriptive verbs ('updated', 'correct') without vivid verbs or risk adjectives.
The segment reports numerical metrics ('at least one person', '36 dairy herds') using standard descriptive verbs ('confirmed') and a factual qualification ('likely undercount').
The segment reports a numerical metric ('one in five milk samples') using standard descriptive verbs ('announced its finding', 'had') without vivid verbs or risk adjectives.
The segment reports numerical metrics ('56 percent') using standard descriptive verbs ('reported', 'were') without vivid verbs or risk adjectives.
